Copyright Â© University of the Philippines 2020. Developed by DARE-Project 3 Team of UP-NCPAG. This app is part of the efforts of the UP COVID-19 Pandemic Response Team spearheaded by the UP Resilience Institute (UPRI).
Visit www.safetravel.ph. For comments and suggestions, send email at admin@safetravel.ph

The SafeTravelPH mobile app allows commuters to report and view road conditions and accidents; monitor Public Utility Vehicle (PUV) availability and locations, arrival times at transit stops, and occupancies of buses; and rate and record the quality of their trips. At the same time, the app allows bus providers to better calibrate their routes, monitor their operations and improve their overall systems in response to crowdsourced data provided by the application.

The app, which is free to use by all stakeholders, aims to help improve the quality, sustainability, and reliability of public transport services. It provides relevant real-time information to commuters and bus operators and more importantly, government agencies involved in the planning and management of the public transportation sector. We believe that the system will contribute in improving public transport systems in the country by providing an open data platform for public transport planning and policy-making.

Developed by the Data Analytics for Research and Education (DARE)-Project 3 (Information Exchange Platform for the Public Sector) Team of UP-NCPAG. This app is part of the efforts of the UP Pandemic Response Team spearheaded by the UP Resiliency Institute (UPRI).
